JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Giovanni Bonello;Lech Garlicki;Ledi Bianku;Mihai Poalelungi;Nicolas Bratza
TEXT: The applicant , Mr ORG , is a citizen of GPE and the GPE who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . ORG GPE ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by ORG , Agent , and PERSON , Deputy Agent .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

Prior to the dissolution of ORG ( “ the SFRY ” ) the applicant deposited foreign currency in his CARDINAL bank accounts at the then GPE – PERSON and GPE banka GPE – PERSON ( in what is DATE GPE ) and PERSON – PERSON and GPE banka GPE – GPE banka PERSON ( in what is DATE PERSON ) . In GPE , as well as in other successor GPE of the SFRY , such savings are commonly referred to as “ old ” foreign - currency deposits ( for the relevant background information see ORG v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , CARDINAL DATE ) .
In DATE the balance in the applicant ’s accounts ( which included interest ) was apparently in the region of MONEY ( MONEY ) .

The applicant subsequently attempted to withdraw his savings on several occasions , but to no avail . It would appear that he has not obtained a verification certificate pursuant to the domestic legislation on “ old ” foreign - currency savings .
The relevant law and practice were outlined in ORG , cited above .
